result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric A Odell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Set for plea/sentencing hearing in approximately 45 days
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not be at any bar or tavern. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $300.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
